review: Ok, first off I'm not a die hard amazon fan. They have needlessly censored reviews of some of my good friends. That being said, when I was searching for the best streaming device on the market fire tv won hands down. I can stream Netflix through it (new app is listed in popular apps section with white background while old app is still upfront with red background).  My overall impression is that fire tv is the best streaming device on the market currently. I have satellite internet and have no problem streaming content (which has been an issue with another device). You don't have to have amazon prime. You can use this device just for Netflix or Hulu.  Bottom line it's worth the money. Netflix, Hulu, or amazon prime are all less expensive than dish or cable. For the cost of the initial investment you'll save a lot of money on the back end. As of today I would probably choose Netflix over amazon prime if your strictly talking about watching tv. However, if you use prime for free shipping, then you have to bring that into the equation.

review: My Fire TV has turned out to be a dud. This would be a 5 star review if Amazon would help me and repair or replace it but I have contacted customer service twice and they have refused to do anything and the second time I contacted them that said they needed to escalate it to another department and PROMISED they would get back to me and they never did. The issue I have with it, is the sound cuts down to a lower volume and sounds echoey frequently. The only fix is to get up and physically unplug it and plug it back in. Now it happens everytime I use it, within minutes sometimes of watching something and also, the sound now just completely cuts out. It's at the point now it is not even worth using and I'm just back to using my Apple TV, at least it works and maybe it's slow, but it's worked fine for years now. I guess I need to contact Amazon for a third time and hope they won't blow me off again, otherwise this was a $100 paperweight.
